impress.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make someone feel admiration and respect
impress.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
‘He’s a lawyer?’ Mum looked suitably impressed  (=as impressed as you would expect).
We were very impressed by the standard of work.
One candidate in particular impressed us with her knowledge.
I think the chief exec was favourably impressed by your presentation.
impress.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make the importance of something clear to someone
impress.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Father impressed on me the value of hard work.
impress.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it
